title: Customer Loyalty
description: Dwight tries to keep Daryl from leaving Dunder Mifflin, Jim misses his daughter's recital because of an important business meeting, and Nellie is worried that Erin will dump Andy for Pete.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gotta clear out these file cabinets people, a lot of these are dead accounts. "Scranton Mimeograph Corp?" I don't think we're doing business with them any time soon. That's odd.  A letter from Robert Dunder. "A valuable artifact has come into my possession. I have hidden it until such time as a person of strong intellect may safely recover it. This golden chalice is of immeasurable historical and religious significance." The Holy Grail.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone]: Did you send Dwight on a quest for the Holy Grail?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I'm a little too busy these days to s-- [whispering] Oh ,my God. I did send Dwight on a quest for the Holy Grail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The Dunder Code! I completely forgot about that prank. That had to be like six or seven years ago. Stayed late every night for a month. Had a lot more free time back then.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aha! A lightbulb.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: A lightbul-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A lightbulb. Okay. Okay. [holding note over lamp] Invisible ink.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Higher than numbers go." The ceiling above accounting!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight! Down, Dwight! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone]: Man, I wish I was there to see his face when he gets to the end ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...and finds the... fake grail? No grail?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't remember?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: An "X."

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Annex. It must open something in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Sedes introiti." Seat of entrance.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shouts while cutting up seat cushion - gasps upon finding playing cards]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's a flush.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [murmuring as Dwight holds up toy forklift]

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: The warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone to Jim] There's nothing down here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I expected more from young Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's just forget it. Forget it. [warehouse worker dips donut into golden chalice]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So, how are we getting on with our grand social media initiative?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, we created a fake profile for a really cool guy named Derek McBlack.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's just Pete in sunglasses.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And then we had him "Like" Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Then we created a bunch of fake friends for Derek, and we had all of them "Like" Derek's "Likes."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So far, we're only popular with imaginary people, but we think this is the start of something big.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You two are geniuses. And I am a genius putting you two together.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pete and I work well together -- not that there's anything special about Pete. It could be any guy... or girl- not that I'm into girls. Not that I'm into Pete. Ugh! What was the question?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Coworker
quotes.text: Hey Jim. Peter Rowley at Bridgeport Capital requested a meeting at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Can we keep it on the early side, though? I got that thing in Scranton later.

quotes.speaker: Co-worker #2
quotes.text: Uh sure. No problem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cece's ballet recital is today. I cannot wait. I've been working with her on her move. It's called the Cece Spin and Kiss. Do you want to see it? It's kind of like this. It's pretty cute, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pfft, "Athlead"? Please. They're too lazy to call it Athletes Lead? Jim should just call it "Stumpany," for "Stupid Company."

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nothing stupid about working for yourself. Hanging out with pro athletes, getting free tickets to the games. That's why I'm doing it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're working for "Stumpany" too?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, just weekends for now, but pretty soon, I'm switching over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Halpert, what's the big idea? First you jump ship. Now you're stealing Darryl too. When will it end?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, take your worst fear and multiply it by infinity.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You won't stop until you've poached us all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Even you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. I'll be damned if I'm gonna let us lose me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi. How are ya? Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Angela? Did you hear about the Irish-American Cultural Center mural?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, I haven't heard it. So, what about the Irish-American Cultural Center mural? Potato?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, Kevin, it's not a joke. Angela's husband put me up for a- um, just never mind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have no information. But I'm sure as soon as they know, they'll call you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Senator Lipton helped me submit my design for a new mural on a building downtown. Now I'm just waiting to hear from the selection committee. But, you know, let's be realistic. There are a ton of great artists in Scranton with way more experience. I mean, who are they gonna go with -- some nobody like me or a big name like Tracy Fleeb?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I'm heading out to Cece's dance recital.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Aw.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Cece, Daddy's gonna have dinner with us tonight after he comes to your recital. Are you excited?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let's call him.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [line trilling]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. I was just about to call you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Hon, are you close?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am still in Philly, actually.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's insane. This huge investor got cold feet, so I'm stuck here trying to keep him on board.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hon, I wish you would have told me an hour ago, when you knew you weren't gonna make it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, I couldn't get out. I barely made it out just to make this phone call.

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.text: I want Daddy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're gonna do great. And you know what? Mommy's gonna record it. So we'll watch it together. Do you mind doing that, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Are you sure you know how to do video on the phone?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, Jim, I think I know how to point a rectangle at something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay, you know, just sometimes you're not the best with the phone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know how to operate my phone, okay? Listen, we're getting close. We will talk to you later. Say, "Bye, Daddy."

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.text: Bye, Daddy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.  [pause] Yep. See, you've still got to press "End," Pam.

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.text: Press "End."

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, check it out. This is our first real "Like."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh! All right, Alan Olson from North Dakota. He also likes Hammermill and Georgia Pacific.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow. That guy's really into paper.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well done, you two.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We did it. Youth task force forever.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [doing a series of hand bumps with Erin] Bap, bup, bup, bap. Wait. Did I go first and then you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, you go -- okay.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: All right, all right.Okay, start over.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no, no. Oh God. Andy has just started to be nice to me, I just sent his girlfriend into the arms of a younger man.  "Our social media presence should be hot, hot, hot. Go at it vigorously." I did everything but unzip their pants for them. Oh, God, Nellie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, everybody. Uh, coffee order is going around -- on me. Just sign your name below.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [murmuring]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait. This says "Dunder Mifflin Loyalty Pledge"?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This -- uh, what? Double mocha latte, please? You got it. Just sign your name below. Whatever you want.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: "Loyalty pledge"?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight, stop overreacting. I'm getting all my work done here. No customers have complained. Nobody even knows.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, we'll see about that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bust out your complaint files. I need everything you've got on Darryl since he started working for Jim in the last few weeks. Break it down by keyword, okay? "Infuriating, irresponsible"...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: They got us set up with Windows 95,  so you're kind of dreaming here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I'm gonna need you to print it out.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [dot matrix printer beeping and whirring loudly]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [writing on white board] Customer Loyalty. What is it? Can you hold it in your hand? Can you nudge it with your finger? Can you dump it on a woman? No. Why? Because it's an idea. But what does it mean?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, it's when you get a free sandwich after you've already eaten ten sandwiches.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not even close. Mr. Romanko has been a client for 20 years. He came in today in a rage. Why? Because of Darryl. Because Darryl was focusing on outside projects and needs to remember his first priority- the client.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Romanko
quotes.text: I wouldn't say a rage.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mr. Romanko, we were a day late on one of your deliveries, but two of our trucks were down for repairs. It's very unlikely it would happen again.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Romanko
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, you're not going anywhere, okay? You are angry, and we are gonna hear you out, all right? Because business is about relationships, and the key to relationships is what, Darryl?  L-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Loyalty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Loyalty.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Loyalty is exactly right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes. I mean, it is everything. Let's all ask ourselves, have we been faithful in our relationships?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's none of your damn business.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Darryl is "dating" Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Darryl is dating Val... still.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: But he's flirting with Jim's company on the side. And we all know what flirting can lead to.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Romanko
quotes.text: I'm sorry. Do I still need to be here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm having a bit of trouble understanding the importance of loyalty. So let's- let's use an example. Take Erin. Erin's boyfriend Andy, is away across the ocean.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So is it all right for her to flirt with Creed, for example?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Let's try it out.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No, let's- let's- let's not say Creed. Let's say Mr. X.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I think it would be immoral for Erin to cheat on Andy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Didn't you cheat on Andy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes. And he didn't like it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Does Mr. X know that Erin has a boyfriend, or did Erin keep that from Mr. X?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, this is really hard to follow. Can we just say Pete because that's the guy that Erin's flirting with?

quotes.speaker: Dance Teacher
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the Little Ladybug Ballerinas.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star plays]

quotes.speaker: Ballerinas
quotes.text: One, two, three.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam's cell phone ringing]

quotes.speaker: Parent in Audience
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Ballerinas
quotes.text: One, two, three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Hello? Yes, this is Pam Halpert. I got the mural? [Loudly] Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Audience
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Um, I'm sorry. I have to go. My daughter's a ladybug. I know that doesn't make any sense. Um, thank you, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Parent in audience #2
quotes.text: You're very rude.

quotes.speaker: Parent in audience #1
quotes.text: Yes, very rude.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shh! Kids are dancing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you so much for coming. Darryl and I will be here to serve you for years and years and years and years. [chuckles] So, should we go call Jim and tell him to go screw himself?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Dwight, look, I'm sorry you're having a hard time with this, okay? Athlead is my future. No disrespect to Dunder Mifflin, but if I can have fun at work, I want that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It can't be more fun than selling paper and paper products.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It can.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you pretending to be crazy, huh?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, Andy's cute, but he's too vanilla, whereas Pete - he's just one sick dude. I mean, you know this guy likes to get weird.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm just gonna say this one more time. Pete and I haven't done anything.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah right. With slammin' bods like that, they ain't playing checkers.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: People, it's 2013. Erin is a strong, independent woman. Who says she has to end up with any man?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, can everyone please stop speaking for me? Andy is my boyfriend. Pete and I are just friends. And that's the end of it. Right, Pete?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That is correct. Come on, guys, where is this even coming from?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Your feelings for Erin? Probably your heart... and a little bit your penis.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [groan]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nellie, you have to shut down the task force. I'm not sure if you need to start a new task force to do that, but please just shut down the task force.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I suppose that will- that will be all right, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Most relationships eventually die on their own, but sometimes they just need a little pillow over the face. You're welcome, Andy. And you're welcome, my own ass.

quotes.speaker: Investor
quotes.text: Listen, I appreciate you taking the time with me.

quotes.speaker: Coworker
quotes.text: Peter, please. We completely understand your concerns here. Let us just show you the latest projections. Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Wade actually has those on the road, but he's gonna be calling in with those numbers any second. So just hold on one s-

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [cell phone vibrates]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, actually... uh, nope. That is my wife. Again, he'll be calling in any second.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, uh, give me a call back when you get a chance. Cece did great, and I want to tell you something.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: Hey boss, you gotta jump on a delivery.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't do that anymore.

quotes.speaker: Lonny
quotes.text: That's what they told me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, let's get this over with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You looking for fun? It just found you! Woo! [laughs] Here we go! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, we will be delivering a shipment of paper today, but I will also be delivering you a big shipment of fun!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [We are young plays on radio]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How far is this place? [turns off radio]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, not far at all, but I thought along the way, we could play some sports. [throws small ball at Darryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Fun.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, really nice job in that meeting in there.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. I don't know, I sort of thought-

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [hugging Nellie] So proud of you, Hon.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, I don't know. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm just curious though, what do you have against Pete and Erin?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, Andy wrote me a really nice recommendation letter for the adoption agency, and I- I just sort of felt I owed him one.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Pete's a pretty cool guy, though, and Andy was a terrible lover to Erin. He basically ignored her and left on a boat.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I didn't really think about it like that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, well... Not everybody has what we have.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: "What we have"?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I just remembered... I kissed that man. Oh, no. Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Fast food. I'll take a burger over a gross Philly cheese-steak any day.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: They have fast food in Philly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not like this.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Exactly like this.

quotes.speaker: Fast Food Worker
quotes.text: And your milkshake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's 30 degrees out. You drinkin' a mildshake?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nope. [throwing milkshake] Fire in the hole! [laughs] Oh, yeah! Now that's what working at a paper company's all about!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Darryl take keys out of ignition]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, what you doing? No, I need the k- We have to go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You just threw a milkshake in a restaurant where they make minimum wage.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a youtube thing! Let's go. Let's go. Come on, they're coming.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Anyone want to see the video from Cece's recital?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, I would love to, but I am swamped... with that [picks up piece of paper].

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'll watch it. Let's get this over with.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All right, you don't have to.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Let's get this over with, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [sound of applause on phone]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait. What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [recorded on phone] Excuse me, I have to get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no. I took a phone call in the middle of taping, and then when I went to turn it back on, I must have turned it off.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: User error. I've heard of that happening to other people.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oscar, don't rub it in. I'm sure Pam is already kicking herself for choosing a phone call over her child.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, it was an important phone call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I haven't told anyone here about the mural yet. I want Jim to be the first to know. Whenever I tell him good news, he's always like, "Beesly!" I love that. Only thing better than getting the job- "Beesly!" [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hello, Peter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [cleaning up milkshake in restaurant] It barely even feels like a prank anymore.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You missed a spot.

quotes.speaker: Drive Thru Customer
quotes.text: Fire in the hole! [throwing milkshake] Go! Go! Go! Go! [tires screech]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha ha! Yeah, joke's on you buddy! They make you come back and clean it up!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I am sorry that was so awkward for you two in that meeting. But I am going to have to reassemble the youth task force.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, no, I really don't think that's a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, that is not your call. I made the decision. You have no choice in the matter, and everybody knows it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Well, okay, then.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I guess we don't have a choice.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Lady...you never stop surprising me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? What was that? Did I just hear you laughing with glee?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No. I was clearing my throat.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Night

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night, Creed.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [cell phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, how's it going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We lost Bridgeport Capital. I have no idea what happened. It's like everything I did, he just wouldn't go for it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have no idea where we're gonna come up with this money, and we have to work insanely hard over the next few weeks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sighs] Oh, I'm sorry. I feel like you've already been working insanely hard.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can you figure out how to upload Cece's dance recital? I definitely could use a pick-me-up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, actually, funny story -- I didn't get it. I shouldn't have been so cocky about my rectangle-holding skills after all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not serious, are you? You didn't get any of the recital?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I got the teacher introducing them and then the applause afterwards. But not so much of the middle part.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on, Pam. Pam, I asked you if you could use the phone, and you swore that you knew how.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, okay, I'm sorry. I'm sure we can get a copy. A lot of people were taping it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, great. So we'll see somebody else's kid with Cece in the background? I mean, it's really not that hard to film a video.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is there- um... you want to ease up a little bit?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, Pam, I don't know what to tell you. I mean, what do I do? It's gone. That moment's just gone. I missed it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know, Jim -- maybe you should have been there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not serious, right? I mean, how is that fair? I'm in Philly. These are my days in Philly. You've agreed to this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what? I- I- I don't think you want to start a conversation with me about what's fair. Okay? This is way more intense than I ever --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, I'm not explaining this to you- Pam, I'm not going over this again.

quotes.speaker: Coworker
quotes.text: Jim. We need you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know how else to tell you, okay? I'm doing everything I can every week to bring home something...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am- I am- I am trying to make everything perfect here, okay? So that you can have everything that you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm doing this just for me? Is that what I'm doing? I'm doing it just for me. If that's what you think, then this is a really sad night. But you know what? I got to go. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We'll talk tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye. [quietly crying, sniffling]

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Hey, you okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What am I doing wrong, Brian?

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Nothing. You're doing the best you can.

quotes.speaker: Camera Man
quotes.text: Brian.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Give her a minute. Give her a minute.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [crying]

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Hey, it's just a tough situation, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's getting tougher. I just didn't know that it was gonna be this hard.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Yeah. Let's turn the cameras off. Seriously, guys. Enough. Enough.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: [on video] Fire in the hole! Go! Go! Go! Go!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [watching you tube video, laughing]

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: [on video] I nailed that guy, dude. Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And replay.

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: [on video] Fire in the hole! Go! Go! Go! Go! I nailed that guy, dude. Oh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [sighs] I'm gonna miss the paper business.
